adrFormatAddress: 1140 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text:
I went for color 2 days before my 6-week membership benefit kicked in. (As a member, I was told I can get color 1x per month.)
I was charged full price. The salon said they'd "take care of me" so I wouldn't pay twice - at holiday time! This was a lie. When I called Customer Service, the rep said there were no notes in the system. My experiences at MR are inconsistent at best. When I had my color done in November, it washed out. I was not up for paying more in December- particularly after being told that I'd see a refund which I never saw. Don't recommend. Amy's leadership (the CEO) is sloppy - and it shows! I've cancelled my membership since this took WAY too much time - and lying isn't acceptable.

originalText.text: Awful experience!  I went end of December 2023.  I arrived early and my appointment started on time.  The colorist was 5 minutes into applying my color and another female colorist came over and told him to "hurry up" because he had a blow dry to do.  Needless to say, he missed several areas, so I had gray spots showing through.  I had to redo the color myself at home.  He told me the color had to stay on for 45 minutes.  After 55 minutes I finally got up and went to the front desk to say I needed to be rinsed. He was standing up at the front talking to another employee and acted annoyed that I wanted rinsed.  He said his timer was on silent, so he didn't hear it.  He aggressively shampooed me only 1 time.  Shampoo and water were flying all over and even hit the wall next to me.  Without asking, he slathered on a lot of conditioner.  The service was so bad, I didn't even want to leave a tip, but I did since it was near the holiday.  I may try the branch downtown, but will never go back to this shop.  All they have to do is apply color and rinse and they can't even do that properly!!

originalText.text: Love love my hair! Juana and EV did a fantastic job at the location on 3rd Ave between 66th and 67th Street! Both took their time and made sure that I was happy with everything they did!

text.text: Love love my hair! Juana and EV did a fantastic job at the location on 3rd Ave between 66th and 67th Street! Both took their time and made sure that I was happy with everything they did!

originalText.text: I've been coming to this Madison Reed Color Bar for a year now. Every two-three weeks if I'm in the city. Absolutely love it!

text.text: I've been coming to this Madison Reed Color Bar for a year now. Every two-three weeks if I'm in the city. Absolutely love it!

originalText.text: Ooof. I don’t know what went wrong yesterday but my hair is completely botched and I’m so upset. I’ve been to this location before and they did a great job for all over color but yesterday I got my roots done (which I’ve done many times at the Williamsburg location) and my hair is two different colors. I don’t understand what went wrong because I thought they had a system and always use the same color. My stylist also added a colored gloss which I did not ask for because I like the color my hair had faded too.  I noticed a weird smell while my hair was being shampooed for the 3rd time and when I asked she said “oh this is a gloss to make the roots match since it was faded”. At the other location they’ve been matching my roots to the faded color which is what I wanted all along. Super upset about the experience. And to top it off, while she put the gloss on it got on my $300 cream colored pants and they’re ruined. This stylist is really kind and has done my hair before but my hair is so messed up I have to say something. I’ve washed it 4 times and I still look ridiculous.
